column4: does anyone know how to get the "fglrx" module loaded at bootup? i installed the ati catalyst 7.11 driver, because i wanted aiglx support, but i have to manually get it working every time i boot up with this temporary fix: http://www.phoronix.com/forums/showthread.php?t=6062 (first reply to original post)
You could add it as a service to start up upon boot.
If it doesn't require root, you can do it using System -> Preferences -> Sessions
If it does require root, you'll have to add a system-v style startup script.
oh. i guess i'll have to do that then
